pr_title: Beam-2535: Support timer output timestamps in the flink runner

timeline.bodyText: This was the missing piece. Without this, we can't make progress when a timer has fired.
timeline.author: mxm

replies.bodyText: Thanks!  I didn't put a call here, because the way the code is structured that would result in two calls to updateWatermarkHold every time you set a timer. Would it be sufficient to add the call in fireTimer, as it appears that's that path we missed.
replies.author: reuvenlax

replies.bodyText: Yes, that's right. My first thought was to add it in fireTimer, but then I thought I could simplify it further. That led to the duplicate update call when you set the timer. Looks like we have just update the hold on set, delete, and fire, and not for cleanup.
replies.author: mxm

timeline.message: Support output timestamps in flink runner.

timeline.author: mxm

replies.bodyText: Nit: non-final fields are null by default. The annotation probably helps to indicate the default null value.
replies.author: mxm
